instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related issues and kernal Panics
threads.message:
I have an untouched <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here with no liquid damage.

The symtoms are somewhat similar to the bad <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>'s sometimes it boots sometimes it does not, 
When it is running its not for long, the screen freezes and it restarts. Ive also had a couple of kernal panics during boot

Im struggling to believe its the GPU itself as i have heated the Die of the chip and it made negligible difference.
I have also resolsdered the GPU power regulator as you would on the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>'s
I have replace a poly tant on the pp1v05 GPU rail.

Nothing has seemed to change much, im wondering if its something cold solder related somewhere as it seems to boot far less often when the heatsink is clamped down.

I really dont know what my next step is? Change the caps on the GPU phases? fully reflow the GPU and see if the fault persists,ect

my main question is has anyone seen it before and fif they ever resolve it? 

Thanks guys.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related issues and kernal Panics
threads.message: <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> can cause similar issues, resolder that one first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related issues and kernal Panics
threads.message: <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> was replaced yestarday when i was diagnosing it. No change in symptoms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related issues and kernal Panics
threads.message: Did you reflow everything [B]around[/B] the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> area too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related issues and kernal Panics
threads.message: There are no other common problems on these. Can you post the panic report here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related issues and kernal Panics
threads.message:
[QUOTE="G.Beard, post: 22518"]Did you reflow everything [B]around[/B] the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> area too?[/QUOTE]

What, all the 0201's? they probably got hot enough. I reflowed the both the gmux related chips maybe <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9650</CHIP>? (sorry, im terrible at giving part numbers, i rarely need to look at a schematic)

I will post a kernal report within a few days if i catch it. I was told it artifacts too, but its not something ive come across in the 5 minutes ive managed to get it booted for.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related issues and kernal Panics
threads.message: If it artifacts then it must be GPU or VRAM or in a bad case the actual PCB. Change the GPU and VRAM.
